question: Hey, Mike. Check this one out.
answer: He's huge!

question: They've been like this all week. Must be something extra tasty in the water.
answer: Like what?

question: Dead coyote. Snake maybe. Back in the 'Nam we'd eat python with a dash of habanero sauce. Mighty satisfying.
answer: You ate snake?

question: When you're thirty klicks out from the nearest firebase. Humpin' through the wake-up with your finger on the trigger. Charlie doesn't give you time to stop for cutlet. Quiet, bird. We're working. The sun is going down, my nocturnal hunters. It's time to come out and feed.
answer: Yeah. They're definitely getting bigger.

question: I've calculated a growth factor of twelve percent over the last forty-eight hours. But that seems to be accelerating.
answer: All from eating these bugs? Maybe I should try some. Run, little guys.

question: They can't outrun the food chain.
answer: I could get away.

question: Imagine yourself the size of that fly. A scytodes spitter would be as big as a Cadillac. You'd be spider chow, kid.
answer: Are the new tarantulas in here?

question: Took me forever to get a breeding set of Chilean reds. I must have bribed every customs agent from Vegas to Santiago.
answer: That is too cool.

question: Male tarantulas compete for the female's attention. Each one tries to bring her the best present. Bugs, rats, even the occasional parrot. The prey is cocooned alive so she can eat them in her nest. You know how women love breakfast in bed. Take a look, the female of the species is three times as big as the male. Say hello to Consuela. She fills her prey with digestive acid to liquify the internal organs. Now watch... She'll drink her victim from the inside out. While it's still alive!
answer: And you wonder why my mom doesn't like me hanging out with you.

question: Arachnids have been roaming the earth for millions of years. And they'll be here long after the human race is dead and buried.
answer: Bad! Bad Consuela! Do that again and I feed you to the parrot.

question: There's your mom.
answer: See you tomorrow, Joshua!

question: You should see them, Mom. Each one has a unique feeding behavior. The spitters fire poisonous snot. The tarantulas mummify their prey. The jumpers can...
answer: Why does he have all those things?

question: He studies them. NASA uses spider webs in outer space. And for medicine. They've been here forever, and they'll be here long after we're all dead.
answer: You're givin' me nightmares.

question: Nightmares are cool.
answer: U.P.S. brought this to the station.

question: It's from Dad! He didn't forget my birthday. I told you he wouldn't.
answer: Better late than never.

question: Rockin'!
answer: Is that the one you wanted?

question: Cassiopeia 2304 with 64 megs of ram. Integrated modem. Voice recording capability. This baby is tight.
answer: What's wrong?

question: He forgot to send the batteries.
answer: I told him to send batteries.

question: I can always count on you, Mike.
answer: Do you get off on humiliating me?

question: This bad girl act doesn't suit you, Ash.
answer: I'm just trying to have fun. Don't you remember what it's like to grow up here?

question: That's what scares me. I told you to keep this with you.
answer: You are so over protective.

question: A mother's job is to protect her children.
answer: You need to start trusting me.

question: I'd like to. But you keep skipping classes to go to the dunes with Bret.
answer: Why do you hate him so much?

question: I don't hate him. I just want you to have a future. I thought you wanted to get out of town. Go to med school.
answer: Maybe I want to stay. I could get pregnant by nineteen. Then divorce with a couple of kids I can't handle. Slap on a badge and be a trailer trash sheriff.

question: Isn't this just your latest get- rich quick scheme? Your mall has more employees than customers.
answer: I may have overestimated the need for 100,000 square feet of outlet shopping.

question: And your ostrich ranch?
answer: If the government subsidies hadn't dried up, I'd still be rolling in cash. With one phone call I could put together a deal that would make us all very rich.

question: They say money doesn't buy happiness.
answer: They probably don't have any.

question: We have no economy! People are barely scraping by! And now we've been offered the deal of a lifetime. You don't have the right to stand in our way!
answer: Those mines are full of gas. One spark in the wrong place could blow this entire valley sky high. Do you really want to load that gun with toxic waste?

question: Chem-Tech did seismic analysis, vapor checks, groundwater reads, soil sampling. They found isolated methane pockets, but no benzene or hydrogen sulfide.
answer: How could they run tests? I didn't give them permission to go into the mines. I asked you a question, you greedy son of a bitch!

question: It's okay.
answer: Maybe you're not gay after all.

question: What are you talking about?
answer: You can't take your eyes off his butt.

question: Where did you learn that it's okay to talk to me like this?
answer: Relax, Mom. He's hot for an old guy. I can admit it. Why can't you?

question: Did you pop him one?
answer: He had it comin'. But Sam Palmer... That woman abuses her power.

question: Why? Because she stopped you from givin' Wade another pop?
answer: I'm not proud of it. I thought you were trying the patch.

question: I am.
answer: That burner's on the fritz again.

question: Oh something's broken? What else is new? You need to pay these by the end of the month.
answer: Today... For a split second... I actually thought I had it.

question: Another vein of iron pyrite?
answer: Yeah... Then a rat stole my lunch. I practically blew myself up trying to get it back.

question: I'm glad you like my bologna sandwiches. Maybe you should talk to Wade.
answer: What are you saying?

question: Honey, if he really does have a buyer...
answer: You of all people know how much my dad wanted to find that mother lode.

question: Your daddy wanted to get rich. I don't think he cared how that happened. If he was still alive, maybe he'd sell those mines.
answer: And maybe you didn't know him so well after all.

question: You're right... I'm just worried about how we're going to pay these bills.
answer: Don't give up on me, Gladys. I promised him I'd find the gold. And I will.

question: Why do you need to do that as six in the morning!? Do you hate me that much!?
answer: I want to finish before I go to work.

question: You've been saying that for six months!
answer: I can't finish if you keep interrupting! If you're gonna keep pulling the plug...

question: Have you seen Zeke this morning?
answer: He was chasing something earlier.

question: If he got into the wall again, it's your balls in the blender.
answer: Hey, Zeke. Breakfast is ready.

question: I'll get the tuna.
answer: Zeke?

question: What's wrong with him?
answer: I've got him by the tail.

question: Hey, dude. Yeah. You. Wanna buy some smoke?
answer: A pack of cigarettes?

question: Smoke to get high, not to die. My stuff is hydroponically grown in a top secret location. No artificial flavors. No preservatives. Just 110 percent homegrown.
answer: Where's this secret location?

question: I could have a dime bag for you toot sweet. But if I tell you where exactly, I'd have to kill you.
answer: Norman, you know my mom's the sheriff.

question: I had spiders at my house too. We need an exterminator not a sheriff. I don't know, Travis. We're gonna keep an eye out. But we're not gettin' anywhere like this. You should go back out there and look for your animals. If they haven't shown up by tonight. I'll call Fish and Game. Okay?
answer: Mom! Mom! All Josh's spiders are gone!

question: I can't do this right now, Mike! Everyone's having pest problems!
answer: But Joshua is gone!

question: Maybe he's out looking for his spiders?
answer: Mom, I'm serious! You're not listening!

question: Mike... I've got missing pets. Spiders in the plumbing. Rats and mice coming out of basements. And your sister's about to end up on a milk carton. I can't have you losing... Hello? Wade... wait a second... your ostriches?
answer: Came out to feed my birds this morning.

question: Coyotes?
answer: Hell no! My flock had fifty birds! Where'd they go, dammit! Who the hell steals fifty birds that can't even fly!?

question: All this happened last night?
answer: I guess. And we didn't hear a thing.

question: What about him?
answer: Not a peep.

question: How's the ostrich business?
answer: Not so good lately.

question: You've got that new Hummer. You must be makin' enough to pay for it.
answer: You like it? I'll take you for a ride.

question: These birds are insured. Right?
answer: I didn't kill my birds, Sam. Is that what you think? ... reject... absolutely not...

question: We have to go back.
answer: Mike?

question: That was a trapdoor spider's burrow.
answer: What are you talking about?

question: Joshua was feeding his spiders bugs from the creek. And they were getting bigger. What if they didn't stop growing? What if they broke out of their tanks. Ate Joshua. And went into the mines? That could be why the other species are coming out into the open. They're trying to get away from the giant spiders. The ecosystem is out of balance.
answer: Have you been overdosing your Ritalin?

question: Woo-hoo! Haven't you had enough of that?
answer: No such thing. Norman's bud is da'kine. When I medal at the X-Games, Honda will give me full sponsorship. Then I'll take you with me on the Supercross tour. Are you still thinking about going away?

question: I don't know. I want to do something with my life, Bret. Help people. Maybe med school is still an option.
answer: Not if you keep hanging out with me.

question: Thanks, Mom. Slow down...
answer: I thought you loved me.

question: I do!
answer: Then what's the problem? You want to leave town. You don't want to make out.

question: I don't feel...
answer: What?

question: I don't want to lose my virginity in the front seat of a monster truck.
answer: Why didn't you say so? We can go outside. I've got a blanket in the back.

question: No... I guess... I'm just not ready.
answer: Tammy and Larry do it every night!

question: Then call them! Have a menage a trois!
answer: Come on, Ashley. Mommy's not around. You don't have to play the good girl. Let Daddy give you what you really want.

question: Please, Bret... Please don't...
answer: My balls? Ahh! My balls! I pissed myself?! Damn, bee-otch!

question: I told you to back off!
answer: Ashley, wait!

question: Screw you, Bret. I'm going home.
answer: Please! Open the door! I'm sorry!

question: I can't believe my mom was right about you. Do you know how embarrassing that is?
answer: Open the door, baby! I love you! I want to marry you! Have my children! Please! Get out of here! They're coming! Ride!

question: What are you doing home?
answer: Need some rat traps.

question: Try the basement.
answer: What is all this?

question: I wanted to surprise you with a special dinner. Turkey De La Gladys.
answer: I'll have mine without Nicotine.

question: Not as good that way.
answer: Rats... Have you been smoking?

question: No.
answer: Gladys...

question: Get back to work. I'll see you tonight. Sam called for you. She wants you to come by the station.
answer: She really has it in for me.

question: Oh please.
answer: What?

question: You two should just sleep together and get it over with.
answer: Me and Sam... Hook up...

question: I may be older than electricity, but I used to be a nice-looking piece of tail.
answer: Too much information.

question: I'm not kidding. I got more action than those chicks on VIP. So when I tell you Sam thinks your butt is U.S.D.A. choice...
answer: This is where I throw up.

question: Nothing yet. I'm sorry. We're still trying to get... Let me call you back. This has been one crazy day. We've got missing pets, dead ostriches. God only knows what's next.
answer: I'm sorry about yesterday. Wade is... He knows how to push my buttons.

question: I wanted to ask you...
answer: On a date? I'm kidding. What did you want to ask?

question: Have you noticed anything strange in the mines?
answer: Define strange.

question: I had spiders in my house. Hector had roaches in his basement. Some mice...
answer: How about stampeding rats?

question: Were they running away from something?
answer: Could have been. Never saw them do that before. I guess it qualifies as strange. Sam... Do you want to go out sometime?

question: Are you asking me out on a date?
answer: Only if you're going to say yes. So that's a 'No.'

question: My kids are the world to me, Chris. When their dad left... it really took a toll. On all of us. I can't go through that again. I won't.
answer: No... I understand... I don't know what I was thinking... Gladys has some crazy ideas. I'm gonna kill her. No! Let me go! Gladys! Let me go!

question: Maybe she got out.
answer: She was cooking. The stove was broken.

question: Is Bret here?
answer: No.

question: Then why is his truck out front?
answer: Don't worry about it.

question: What do you mean? What happened?
answer: Nothing. Nothing happened, alright!

question: Spiders shed their skins when they grow. Like snakes.
answer: Gladys is dead.

question: Maybe not. This is a tarantula's leg. Or it was. It's an exoskeleton, to be scientific.
answer: It's a little large.

question: What is this?
answer: A spider's leg! Careful!

question: No. That's a piece of cactus. Look... It's covered with spines.
answer: Those are quills! Tarantulas can flick them at you like darts!

question: Giant tarantulas?
answer: Tarantulas! Wolfs! Trapdoors! Joshua had a ton of exotics!

question: I guess I should watch more 'Oprah.' It must be a textbook 'no-dad' kind of thing.
answer: That one looks kind of scratchy.

question: All Jason cared about was getting out and starting over. I guess that included buying a new wardrobe.
answer: Gladys thought I should sell... but you know... I never wanted to get rich. If it was about the money, I would have sold out to Wade a long time ago. I think I just wanted to prove the gold was down there. That my family wasn't crazy to keep looking. Even after we'd lost so much. And now... she's gone, too.

question: I'm sorry, Chris.
answer: Do you know what I'm trying to say?

question: It wasn't about spending the gold, it was about finding it.
answer: That's right. That's exactly right. Remind me never to let you do my laundry.

question: Can't you turn that down?! I'm doing spider research!
answer: Spider... Mike... Spider...

question: Wow! A scytodes spitter!
answer: Where are you going?

question: The scytodes spits a gooey discharge to immobilize their prey.
answer: No shit! Use my stun g...

question: I'm calling from Prosperity Nevada! We're being attacked by giant spiders! The entire town has been overrun!
answer: No! Don't say that! What happened?

question: They didn't believe me!
answer: What a shock! Try again!

question: There was a massive explosion! Everybody's dead! She hung up on me!
answer: Climb!

question: At least they can't follow us.
answer: Which way do we go?

question: I think we're in one of the old tunnels.
answer: Can you get us out of here?

question: It's okay. It's okay.
answer: Am I... dead?

question: You're okay.
answer: I'm not in heaven?

question: No...
answer: Then what's with all the gold?

question: Keep going up the tunnel. There should be a generator at the exit. Start it up and await for my signal to throw the switch.
answer: And the toxic waste...

question: Will be buried under tons of rock! Go!
answer: What about you?

question: I need to set the fuse as close to the spiders as I can. That should give us time to get clear.
answer: He has a cute butt. Don't you think?
